items.description:
Wow. These newsletters keep getting later and later. Sorry about that. I'll be caught up when Ignite 2021 finishes. ;-)

As always lots of great community content, but make sure you check out the video of David Ortinau and Maddy Leger talk about Maui and .NET 6.

Have a great week everyone

♥

Kym

items.title: Implementing Dark & Light Modes
items.description:
With modern mobile devices supporting both dark & light modes, users expect applications to respect those settings. Since Xamarin.Forms version 4.6.0.967, we can easily add support to our apps using the AppThemeBinding markup extension. In the blog, I will show you the most interesting parts needed to implement this functionality with a sample application.

Implementing Dark & Light Modes in Xamarin.Forms Apps by Trailhead Technology
items.description_markdown:
With modern mobile devices supporting both dark & light modes, users expect applications to respect those settings. Since Xamarin.Forms version 4.6.0.967, we can easily add support to our apps using the AppThemeBinding markup extension. In the blog, I will show you the most interesting parts needed to implement this functionality with a sample application.

[**Implementing Dark & Light Modes in Xamarin.Forms Apps**](https://trailheadtechnology.com/implementing-dark-light-modes-in-xamarin-forms-apps/) by [Trailhead Technology](https://twitter.com/@TrailheadTec)

embedded_links.title: **Implementing Dark & Light Modes in Xamarin.Forms Apps**

items.title: Beautiful Tabs with Xamarin Community Toolkit TabView
items.description:
One of the hardest parts of apps to customize is the tab bar. With the TabView in the Xamarin Community Toolkit, we make this a breeze!

items.title: Display your Location in OpenStreetMaps
items.description:
The Syncfusion Maps control for Xamarin has built-in support for external imagery services like OpenStreetMap (OSM) and Bing Maps to visualize satellite, aerial, street, and other map imagery tiles without using shapefiles.

How to Display Current GPS Location in OSM Maps Using Xamarin.Essentials by Sheik Syed
items.description_markdown:
The Syncfusion Maps control for Xamarin has built-in support for external imagery services like OpenStreetMap (OSM) and Bing Maps to visualize satellite, aerial, street, and other map imagery tiles without using shapefiles. 

[**How to Display Current GPS Location in OSM Maps Using Xamarin.Essentials**](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/post/how-to-display-current-gps-location-in-osm-maps-using-xamarin-essentials.aspx) by [Sheik Syed](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/author/sheiksyedmsyncfusion-com)

embedded_links.title: **How to Display Current GPS Location in OSM Maps Using Xamarin.Essentials**

items.title: Xamarin App Themes
items.description:
The theme of your app is what makes it stand out, fit in with your brand identity and create a lasting impression. With Xamarin.Forms it's simple to implement multiple themes and styles, and then use them throughout your application.

Xamarin Let's Build - App Themes by Mike Grant
items.description_markdown:
The theme of your app is what makes it stand out, fit in with your brand identity and create a lasting impression. With Xamarin.Forms it's simple to implement multiple themes and styles, and then use them throughout your application.

[**Xamarin Let's Build - App Themes**](https://mikegrant.org.uk/2021/02/22/xamarin-lets-build-app-theme.html) by [Mike Grant](https://twitter.com/mike_grant_)

items.title: Turn any Event into a Command
items.description:
In the final chapter of fully MVVMifying the ListView we are going to take a look at turning events into commands using the Xamarin Community Toolkit! This is a great way to get rid of all of those nasty events or weird data bindings and just call a simple Command!

Turn any Event into a Command in Xamarin.Forms (MVVM All The Things) by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
In the final chapter of fully MVVMifying the ListView we are going to take a look at turning events into commands using the Xamarin Community Toolkit! This is a great way to get rid of all of those nasty events or weird data bindings and just call a simple Command!

[**Turn any Event into a Command in Xamarin.Forms (MVVM All The Things)**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7mpe_1okwxk) by [James Montemagno](https://channel9.msdn.com/niners/jamesmontemagno)

embedded_links.title: **Turn any Event into a Command in Xamarin.Forms (MVVM All The Things)**

items.title: Scan Barcode from Image in Xamarin.Forms with Firebase ML Kit
items.description:
The most obvious scenario is to scan a barcode through a camera, but what if you have an image that contains a barcode and you want to recognize that? In this video we will learn how to use Firebase ML Kit through the BarcodeScanner.XF library to do just that.

Scan Barcode from Image in Xamarin.Forms with Firebase ML Kit by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
The most obvious scenario is to scan a barcode through a camera, but what if you have an image that contains a barcode and you want to recognize that? In this video we will learn how to use Firebase ML Kit through the BarcodeScanner.XF library to do just that.

[**Scan Barcode from Image in Xamarin.Forms with Firebase ML Kit**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sAj9LiCAGlQ) by [Gerald Versluis](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBBZ2kXWmd8eXlHg2wEaClw)

embedded_links.title: **Scan Barcode from Image in Xamarin.Forms with Firebase ML Kit**

items.title: Null Pointers 41: Being Productive
items.description:
A question we get asked is: how do you have time to do all these things?! Spoiler alert: we have no clue! But we have opinions, tips, points (get it...?) and bad jokes, so we're going to talk about how to be productive and not get distract... Is that a unicorn?!

Null Pointers 41: Being Productive by Null Pointers
items.description_markdown:
A question we get asked is: how do you have time to do all these things?! Spoiler alert: we have no clue! But we have opinions, tips, points (get it...?) and bad jokes, so we're going to talk about how to be productive and not get distract... Is that a unicorn?!

[**Null Pointers 41: Being Productive**](https://nullpointers.io/41/) by [Null Pointers](https://nullpointers.io)

items.title: Web APIs for Xamarin Developers
items.description:
This week, James is joined Brady Gaster who is here to talk to use all ASP.NET Core Web API and why it is absolutely awesome for mobile development with Xamarin. He walks us through some best practices, new features, and awesome libraries that we can use to create powerful backends for our apps.

Web APIs for Xamarin Developers | The Xamarin Show by The Xamarin Show
items.description_markdown:
This week, James is joined Brady Gaster who is here to talk to use all ASP.NET Core Web API and why it is absolutely awesome for mobile development with Xamarin. He walks us through some best practices, new features, and awesome libraries that we can use to create powerful backends for our apps.

[**Web APIs for Xamarin Developers | The Xamarin Show**](https://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/XamarinShow/Web-APIs-for-Xamarin-Developers--The-Xamarin-Show) by [The Xamarin Show](https://channel9.msdn.com/shows/xamarinshow)

embedded_links.title: **Web APIs for Xamarin Developers | The Xamarin Show**
